       AN ACT authorizing the county of Nassau to transfer ownership of certain
         parklands to the Oyster Bay water district

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subject to the provisions of this act, the county of Nassau
    2  is hereby authorized and empowered to discontinue as county parkland and
    3  convey  the  property  described  in  section two of this act, which was
    4  heretofore used by such county for park and/or recreational purposes and
    5  is within the Tiffany Preserve, upon terms to be fixed and determined by
    6  such county and approved by its legislature, to  the  Oyster  Bay  water
    7  district.

   26    S 3. Subject to the provisions of this act, the Nassau county legisla-
   27  ture is hereby further authorized and empowered to convey to the  Oyster
   28  Bay water district a non-pollution easement encompassing a radius of 200
   29  feet  surrounding the property described in section two of this act, the
   30  area of such easement being shown upon a map entitled "OYSTER BAY  WATER
   31  DISTRICT  PLANT  No.  8  PROPOSED  WELL  AND  PUMP  STATION" prepared by
   32  Holzmacher, McLendon & Murrell, P.C. and dated February 2007. Such  land
   33  shall remain open to the general public for passive park and recreation-
   34  al purposes.

   36  effective only upon the condition that on or before the  alienation  and
   37  conveyance  of  lands  described  in  section two of this act and/or the
   38  conveyance of the easement described in section three of this  act,  the

   40  purposes" as such term is defined by Nassau county  local  law  10-2006,

   46    S  5. If the parcel described in section two of this act is greater in
   47  fair market value than the parcel being dedicated as parkland in section
   48  three of this act, the county of Nassau shall dedicate the difference in
   49  the fair market value of such lands for the  acquisition  of  additional
   50  park  lands  and/or for capital improvements to existing park and recre-
   51  ational facilities.
   52    S 6. If the parkland that is being discontinued has  received  federal
   53  funding pursuant to the land and water conservation fund, the discontin-
   54  uance  and  conveyance of park land authorized by the provisions of this
   55  act shall not occur until the county of Nassau  has  complied  with  any
   56  state  requirements  pursuant  to  state issued grants for effected park

    7    S 7. This act shall take effect immediately.
